Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LM6 (Lactomodulin fragment, Synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (66.67%) toLM2I=G: 20%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MRSA BAA 2313 (MIC 0.9-1.7 uM),  C. difficile ATCC 43602 (MIC 0.9 uM), L. monocytogenes ATCC 15313 (MIC 2.3 uM), E. faecium anti-VRE BAA 2317 (MIC 1.3 uM), E. coli ATCC 33694 (MIC 9.2 uM), P. aeruginosa BAA 1744 (MIC 9.3 uM), and S.enterica ATCC 13314 (NA). NA: not observed.
Literature Information.Author: Mousa WK, Shaikh AY, Ghemrawi R, Aldulaimi M, Al Ali A, Sammani N, Khair M, Helal MI, Al-Marzooq F, Oueis E. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Human microbiome derived synthetic antimicrobial peptides with activity against Gram-negative, Gram-positive, and antibiotic resistant bacteria.
